I dont think the working set changes can take the blame for this one (although they were gnarly enough that they might have been responsible for that thing the Pope said last week).  Punting to Susan.

I was running these from HEAD tonight on my linux at home with:
java.version=1.5.0_08
java.vm.info=mixed mode, sharing
java.vm.name=Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
java.vm.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
java.vm.version=1.5.0_08-b03
eclipse.buildId=I20060918-1200

But when I ran the same tests are work with Sun JDK 1.4.2_09 and I20060918-0010 they worked.

PW

The stack trace shows that the key assist dialog gets opened while the test is running.  The NPE occurs while trying to set the focus to the dialog area.

Paul, are you saying that you saw this failure only while running from home?
Does it happen every time?

Yes, it happens to me consistently at home ... but I have no trouble at work.

Maybe it has to do with timing at home, which at least right now seems to be significantly slower than at work (twice as slow).

PW

Hmmm, I've started noticing this error again, at work now.  Maybe there are some more timing changes that are causing this problem.

PW

Paul, are you still seeing this at home?
I could easily add a null check to avoid the NPE, but it still seems odd and I don't want to mask a more serious issue.  It's as if the dialog was closed in the middle of running its open method.  I don't see an obvious hole in the logic that would cause this.

I haven't seen this problem at home or at work in quite a while.  Why not close this, and if it comes up again I'll open a new bug with relevant information.

PW
